sentences: Ma võtsin endale selle asja kaasa.
context: In Estonian, 'asi' is a common noun that means 'thing', 'matter', or 'affair'. It's used to refer to objects, subjects of discussion, or general matters. The word can appear in different contexts - as an object (physical thing), as a topic (subject/matter), or as part of expressions indicating quality or importance ('hea asi' = good thing).
